board.title: Board
board.body:
To see who is on the board of Element Foundation click [here](https://cvrapi.dk/virksomhed/dk/Element-fonden/40645799).
 
The link brings you to a page in the Danish Business Registry with information about Element Fonden which is the Danish name for Element Foundation. The members of the Element Foundation board are listed in the section named "Reelle ejere".

mandate.title: Mandate
mandate.body:
The Element Foundation has been formed as an independent and non-profit-oriented entity by the initiators of the open, decentralized and permissionless MakerDAO system with the virtual currency Element. Its mandate is to safeguard what cannot be technologically decentralized in the Maker Protocol which includes trademarks and other intellectual property, such as open-source copyrights and other relevant [assets](/assets).

For more information about the mandate read the [Element Foundation Trust Deed](https://drive.google.com/file/d/14S-VIKsLtWq9xdVguaIZgNqtXcTkO3Bq/view?usp=sharing).

donations.title: Donate to support the work of Element Foundation.
donations.body: Element Foundation accept donations in any liquid assets on the Ethereum Blockchain sent to the following wallet address:
donations.disclaimer: See the Element Foundation [policy](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zNe5A4yce4A0qs8RPF27rbGoNePEdnMwWf_CmPfWbTo/edit?usp=sharing) for accepting crypto donations

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.body:
Feedback, comments, and other communications to Element Foundation should be directed to: [support@Elementfoundation.org](mailto:support@Elementfoundation.org)

The foundation doesn't have any day to day operational support and can thus not promise immediate response to communications received.

assets.title: Trademark & Assets
assets.body:
The assets that Element Foundation safeguards includes trademarks, trademark associated artifacts such as domains and ENS names, and software. To see which assets Element Foundation holds, select the relevant category: [Element Foundation Asset Registry
(domains, ENS names, Github, SoMe accounts)](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1tW2FeaseSb4ExjRajbes9WURrIc416K6kIcrPc5l1zQ/edit#gid=0) [Trademarks](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ivdXJ1WHbi9GgRhfSIYWgNs3chxuWywYbDhPbIASbao/edit#gid=1600241482) [Software](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ivdXJ1WHbi9GgRhfSIYWgNs3chxuWywYbDhPbIASbao/edit#gid=1534715058) For guidance on permissible use of the trademarks, read the [Element Foundation Trademark Policy](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bk7Tyq_Owss0tBOzX_6BhA3fwenUe6wxYKSxO1JcLwY/edit?usp=sharing).

principles.title: Principles
principles.body:
There could be situations that result in a misuse of the intellectual property, brand assets and goodwill that the community has accrued over the years. In such case, the Element Foundation will use appropriate tools to ensure that the Maker Protocol remains aligned with its core principles.
 
These principles include: 
 
The protocol must be available free of charge, as open source and without restrictions, on equal terms and for anyone.
 There must be a high degree of access and distribution to the unbanked and financially underserved.
  
 The governance of the protocol must take a sustainable approach, and no harmful centralization of the protocol must happen.
 
  Development of the protocol must be in compliance with the legislation in force at any time.
 
 The protocol must be operated using scientific governance that optimizes long term stability, assures diversification of the collateral portfolio, and benefit of Element users.
 
 In practice the intent is that the community can freely use Element trademarks, but abuse by scammers is prohibited, and that malicious attackers of the Protocol are not allowed to mislead users of the Protocol.
